name: Artist
description: The art of performance, persuasion, and emotional manipulation through creative expression.

levels.1: Choose 2 art forms; gain advantage on rolls using them.
levels.2: Use art as a distraction; audience rolls Wisdom against your roll.
levels.3: Viewers must make a check or become fans.
levels.4: Manipulate feelings with advantage; contested Wisdom roll.
levels.5: Your work earns you favor with those who recognize it.

name: Athlete
description: Peak physical prowess in climbing, jumping, sprinting, and inspiring allies in battle.

levels.1: Climb speed equals movement speed.
levels.2: Double jump height.
levels.3: Double sprint speed.

name: Bureaucracy
description: The manipulation and mastery of governmental systems and paperwork.

levels.1: Forge IDs contested by Wisdom checks.
levels.2: Serve as a legal representative.
levels.3: Find invitations to most government functions.
levels.4: Advantage when deceiving police or guards.
levels.5: Have a government contact in any civilized area.

name: Business
description: Knowledge and application of trade, finance, and negotiation.

levels.1: Earn 10% more on trades.
levels.2: Have black market contacts.
levels.3: Estimate item value instantly.
levels.4: Draft service-for-goods contracts; contestable by skill roll.
levels.5: Establish business for 10% sessional profit.

name: Called Shot
description: Targeted ranged attacks aimed at weakening or disabling enemies.

levels.1: Add Dexterity to ranged weapon damage.
levels.2: Gain 1/2 cover when using ranged weapons.
levels.3: May legally obtain heavy weapons.
levels.4: Cover fire gives enemies disadvantage on attacks.
levels.5: Ignore cover when attacking.

name: Called Strike
description: Precision melee strikes to control or disable opponents.

levels.1: Add Constitution to melee/unarmed damage.
levels.2: Opponent has disadvantage against you after you hit them.

4.description: Thrown improvised weapons have 30ft range and +2 damage.

levels.5: Make 2 melee/unarmed attacks per action if one is a Called Strike.

name: Gambling
description: Luck manipulation, bluffing, and risk-reward mastery.

levels.1: Advantage on bluffing.
levels.2: Know when a game is rigged.
levels.3: Flip a coin on a failed attack roll to potentially crit.
levels.4: Advantage on reading intentions.
levels.5: Sense danger level of a situation once per day.

name: Gunning
description: Combat training with ranged weapons, especially in high-pressure scenarios.

levels.1: Enemies have disadvantage when shooting at you while sprinting.
levels.2: Advantage in close-range firefights.
levels.3: Make 2 attacks per action; -5 penalty on 2nd if heavy weapon.
levels.4: Advantage on initiative rolls.
levels.5: Can stun a target using 2 ranged shots.

name: Hijack
description: The art of breaking, entering, and stealing vehicles or valuable tech.

levels.1: Open basic locks and pick pockets.
levels.2: Steal vehicles and disable alarms with advantage.
levels.3: Spot high-value items instantly.
levels.4: Plan a heist with advantage on infiltration rolls.
levels.5: Execute heists with reroll on any 1 failed check.

name: History
description: Deep knowledge of past events, factions, and lost technologies.

levels.1: You never forget past events.
levels.2: Know current wars and political factions.
levels.3: Recreate historical items.
levels.4: Know the location of lost tech.
levels.5: Predict future trends based on history.

name: Mechanics
description: Repair and creation of machines and automated systems.

levels.1: Repair from blueprint without rolling.
levels.2: Install common upgrades with no roll.
levels.3: Replicate known machines faster.
levels.4: Craft unique upgrades with advantage.
levels.5: Create entirely new machines with advantage.

name: Medical
description: Diagnosis and treatment of injuries, conditions, and infections.

levels.1: Heal 1d4 + Wisdom with a kit.
levels.2: Stop Bleeding status.
levels.3: Heal 1d12 + Wisdom.
levels.4: Remove Injured status.
levels.5: Reproduce medicines at half cost.

name: Melee
description: Expertise in close-quarters combat with melee weapons, allowing for defense, aggression, and precision strikes.

levels.1: You have 1/2 cover when wielding a melee weapon within 10ft of an enemy.
levels.2: Deflect incoming shots, gaining +3 Armor Rating; costs one reaction while holding a melee weapon.
levels.3: Your melee weapon damage is increased by +3.
levels.4: Using an action, you can accurately read a target’s Hitpoints.
levels.5: Attempt to finish a target below 25% HP with an opposed roll: 1d20 + Dex bonus + Melee level vs 1d20 + Con bonus.

name: Nutrition
description: Mastery over food, health, and dietary effects, letting you enhance meals and grant special bonuses.

levels.1: Those who eat your food gain +5 movement and immunity to ingested toxins for 12 hours.
levels.2: You can cook exotic beasts, granting unique effects based on the animal.
levels.3: Sniff out rare ingredients that may give enhancements when cooked.
levels.4: Create a signature side dish that grants inspiration once per use.
levels.5: Your signature dish grants a special ability to those who eat it.

name: Navigation
description: The science of finding your way in unknown terrain, and making efficient, sometimes impossible, journeys.

levels.2: Always find a shortcut; 1d20: 1=5%, 20=100%, or halve the travel time.
levels.3: Jump directly to planets or always find civilization if not in Space Age.
levels.4: Plot perfect course through dangerous terrain, adding Navigation roll to vehicle operator.
levels.5: Navigate any foreign terrain without a map.

name: Operator
description: Mastery of piloting and maintaining vehicles or ships, making you an ace behind the wheel or controls.

levels.1: Operate vehicles without a skill check.
levels.2: Advantage on stealth with vehicles or ships.
levels.3: Spot wear and tear and use solid checklists for vehicle maintenance.
levels.4: Advantage on challenging vehicle maneuvers.
levels.5: You and your vehicle become one: repair it without a mechanic check (need parts/equipment).

name: Perception
description: Heightened awareness and observation, letting you spot details, read people, and sense threats.

levels.1: Once per day, gain advantage on your next Perception roll.
levels.2: Double the distance for sounds and sights; advantage on Perception with optics or hearing.

3.description: +2 to rolls when inspecting objects or locations.

levels.4: Advantage on reading people’s intent.
levels.5: Add Intelligence + Wisdom bonus to Perception checks.

name: Religion
description: Understanding of religious lore, spiritual influence, and communion with the divine.

levels.1: Know the basics of two religions.
levels.2: Advantage persuading people to forgive using spirituality.
levels.3: Meditate for 6 hours to clear toxins or sickness.
levels.4: Know of lost religious artifacts; get a clue once per month.
levels.5: Communicate with a deity monthly for unique challenges and rewards.

name: Science
description: Comprehension of scientific fields and their practical, technological, or medical applications.

levels.1: Gain +2 when studying or inspecting new science topics.
levels.2: Advantage identifying new technology.
levels.3: Sabotage technology you understand.
levels.4: Add a scientific academy to your training and gain its bonuses.
levels.5: Apply your Science level to any roll in Technology, Medical, Mechanics, or Nutrition.

name: Speech
description: Persuasive, clear, and compelling use of language in any social situation.

1.description: +2 to Speech rolls when persuading someone.

levels.2: Advantage when bribing with Speech.
levels.3: Communicate with people who don’t speak your language without disadvantage.
levels.4: After a 1-minute conversation, you can assess Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.

5.description: Give a pre-battle speech to grant 6 allies +1 Armor, +2 to hit, or +3 damage for 8 hours (once per long rest).

name: Stealth
description: Remaining unseen, blending into crowds, or vanishing from pursuit.

levels.1: Advantage to Stealth rolls when alone.
levels.2: Hidden in crowds by default.
levels.4: Distraction grants party advantage on Stealth rolls.
levels.5: In combat with 3+ enemies, use a reaction to give 2 attackers disadvantage against you.

name: Street
description: Criminal savvy, underworld contacts, and survival instincts in urban environments.

levels.1: Spot criminals and their gang affiliations.
levels.2: Know when you’re being tailed; advantage tracking trackers.
levels.3: Always have an underground contact.
levels.4: Can’t be surprised in cities.
levels.5: Advantage on attack rolls while in a city.

name: Technology
description: Technical aptitude for programming, digital devices, and mechanical systems.

1.description: Add +2 to any roll involving coding or learning tech.

levels.2: Disable equipment with tools if you understand it.
levels.3: Upgrade devices to Splicers/Data Pads (Space Age) or tweak tech for other uses.
levels.4: Create blueprints for any tech you have access to.
levels.5: Advantage shutting down/dismantling systems on vehicles or crafts.

name: Unarmed
description: Hand-to-hand fighting prowess, grappling, submissions, and battlefield survival.

levels.1: Advantage on physical contests; unarmed damage 1d4+Constitution.
levels.2: Unarmed strikes deal 1d6+Constitution.
levels.3: Master submissions: one success can KO a startled target, or two rounds otherwise. Can dispatch KO’d targets instantly.
levels.4: While unarmed, gain extra attack (Flick).
levels.5: If dropped to 0 HP in combat, regain half HP once/day; after, collapse for 8 hours.
